wikipedia_page.main: David Shaw (1719–1810) was a Scottish minister who served as Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland in 1775.

response: *David Shaw (Australian footballer) (born 1938), Essendon premiership player and club president
*David Shaw (cricketer) (born 1967), English right-handed batsman and medium pace bowler
*David Shaw (American football) (born 1972), wide receiver and Stanford Cardinal head coach
*David Shaw (writer) (1943–2005), American journalist for Los Angeles Times
*David Shaw (British politician) (born 1950), Conservative MP for Dover
*David Shaw (painter) (1952–1989), English print-maker, lecturer and drawing tutor

response: in 1805 Bell married Barbara Shaw, granddaughter of Very Reverend David Shaw. In 1832 they were living at 68 Queen Street in the centre of Edinburgh, since demolished. In his final years he lived at 6 Darnaway Street.Edinburgh Post Office Directory 1840
Rev David Shaw, Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland in 1775 was the minister of Coylton.https://www.geni.com/people/David-Shaw-Min-of-Coylton/6000000021610475733
In 1776 he succeeded the David Shaw as Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland the highest position in the Scottish Church. He was succeeded in turn by James Brown.
